abstract: Russia’s chief arms trader Sergei V Chemezov announces 2007 contract to supply Iran with S-300 air defense missiles is now active, but gives no details; military experts speculate lack of delivery specifics may mean Russian government is heading off breach of contract lawsuit, while using deal’s completion as bargaining chip to get its sanctions lifted.
lead_paragraph: An announcement by Sergei V. Chemezov, Russia’s chief arms trade executive, provided no delivery date or any other details.

headline.main: Russia: Official Says Delayed Deal to Sell Iran Missiles Remains in Force
headline.print_headline: Europe; Russia: Official Says Long-Delayed Deal to Sell Iran Missiles Remains in Force

snippet: An announcement by Sergei V. Chemezov, Russia’s chief arms trade executive, provided no delivery date or any other details.
